comments.body: I was trying to match the behavior of glog, which is to log if the verbosity level is >= the log level.

of course, sorry, I mis-parsed it, I was expecting to see >=, so I missed
tha this was the opposite case.  LGTM

On Thu, Aug 4, 2016 at 9:58 PM, Tim St. Clair notifications@github.com
wrote:

> >  kube::log::info() {
> > -  local V="${V:-0}"
> > -  if [[ $KUBE_VERBOSE < $V ]]; then
>

> verbosity level is >= the log level.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +122,126 @@kube::log::info() {
  local V="${V:-0}"
  if [[ $KUBE_VERBOSE < $V ]]; then
    return
  fi
